channel.title: Comments on: T-SQL Tuesday #13: What the Business Says Is Not What the Business Wants
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: chopstik
item.dc:creator: chopstik
item.description: So, if I'm understanding you correctly, the issue is to listen to the business and hear what they want, then determine the best way to do that - without them telling you how to do it? Certainly a major issue with any business is the non-IT people telling the IT people how to get to the desired endpoint instead of simply saying what they want the end result to be and allowing IT to determine the best way to get to that point. Or did I miss your point?
item.content:encoded: So, if I’m understanding you correctly, the issue is to listen to the business and hear what they want, then determine the best way to do that – without them telling you how to do it? Certainly a major issue with any business is the non-IT people telling the IT people how to get to the desired endpoint instead of simply saying what they want the end result to be and allowing IT to determine the best way to get to that point. Or did I miss your point?
